result.execSummary:
The defendant Jaden Michael Lathrop was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sexual Contact with Child Age 15, Actor Under 19, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.093.
  • Sexual Contact with Child Age 15, Actor Under 19, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.093.
  • Sexual Contact with Child Age 15, Actor Under 19, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.093.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall not have any contact with victim unless authorized by DOC with victim and parent consent through agent.
Defendant shall have such assessments, counseling, treatment and programming as indicated by DOC.
Expungement granted under 973.015 after successful completion of probation without any violations.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jaden Michael Lathrop in court.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Jaden Michael Lathrop.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. State will be filing an amended information and moves to amend to three counts of underage sexual activity (misdemeanors) under 948.093. Court grants amendment. State recommends 3 years probation with 30 days jail, each count consecutive, no contact with victim, counseling, no expungement. Defendant pleads guilty to all counts. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2 and 3. State heard. Attorney Mickelson heard. Expungement requested. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 2 years probation with conditions: court costs, DNA, no contact with victim without authorization and consent of DOC, victim and parents, counseling, expungement on successful completion of probation.

Defendant Jaden Michael Lathrop in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Jaden Michael Lathrop. Attorney Mickelson files Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing form. Court reviews form with defendant and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives right to preliminary hearing. Court binds matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads not guilty to charge. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Preliminary hearing on July 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jaden Michael Lathrop appeared by phone.  Attorney Lisa Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Jaden Michael Lathrop. Defendant is awaiting discharge letter yet. Court will schedule preliminary hearing after discharge. Court questions return of signed bond. Bond received but defendant has not found a stamp yet. Defendant to return signed bond and notify counsel when discharge notice received. Court sets review.
Review scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Jaden Michael Lathrop appeared by phone.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant is currently stationed at Camp Lejeune but is currently in the separation process from the military. Defendant does qualify for SPD. State request signature bond with no contact with victim #1. Court heard and orders $1000 signature bond with a condition not to have any contact with A.L. Status date set. Court finds good cause to waive preliminary hearing time limits.
